column1: "“Please take advantage of lifting this mandate. We need our businesses to operate,” said Mayor Carolyn Goodman, requesting that Gov. Sisolak shorten the projected shutdown in a public comment to city councilmembers.Goodman says she wants to focus on keeping Vegas residents employed.She referenced how in the last 20 years we have survived the West Nile Virus in 2002, SARS in 2004, the Bird Flu in 2005, Ecoli in 2006, Swine Flu in 2009, Ebola in 2004, Zika Virus in 2016, and every year the general flu, “yet we are still here.”“A full shutdown will cripple the states recovery for years because we are a tourism economy that depends on being open for business,” said Goodman referring to the 42 million visitors Las Vegas received last year and 3 million Nevadans."https:/…
"Goodman says she wants to focus on keeping Vegas residents employed."She might want to be a little concerned about keeping them, and the tourists, safe.
Even if all places reopened today, flights are very limited, and people willing to venture there are very limited as well
At what point in social distancing requirements does it become feasible to re-open Las Vegas attractions? Until the reported infection numbers level out or decrease, it seems unwise to re-open.

It's good she's addressing the disastrous economic realities of this situation for the community, but the priority is reducing / minimizing potential exposure of all involved to the bug. That machine is in motion now, looks like. Lots of edges to this COVID sword...and most of them suck. There's no way to predict a timeline...too many unknowns. We'll get through this..including the Vegas workforce...a day at a time.

It seems she has more interest in my tourist $$ than she has in my health - I fully understand that some people will suffer financial hardship in coming weeks & months but equally some people will get sick and some will die.People can be helped to recover from financial hardship but not from death.

I am sure everyone has seen that graph about flatting the curve so that the apex doesn't overwhelm the healthcare system. But was the graph doesn't show is the line that kills the economy and for how long that more flatten curve will kill the economy. Everyone thinks that tidal waves are one massively tall wave, but it is really usually just a few higher feet water surge that flows over land destroying everything. Poverty is the #1 killer in the world and soon or later we are going to have to accept a certain number of deaths from the virus each week or risk poverty becoming America's #1 killer.
This was taken this morning. You can see how seriously guests have taken the guidelines. https:/…1

New York City waited too long and they are sending Navy hospital ships to help with the potential number of cases.It's fine to reevaluate frequently, but the CDC guidance is for far longer than 30 days, right now.People need to stay home, read a book, maybe get into a Twitter war, and wait it out.I certainly understand the impact this has on a city like Las Vegas, but we need to deal with this crisis first.
She's a politician and unless she's also a medical professional with deep knowledge of infectious diseases, she should shut up (CC: the White House)
Don't forget that the medical profession will kill your life to keep you from dying from a disease.

It's not surprising at all, though.One of the big draws of Las Vegas is that it's a place where adults are allowed to make their own choices, even when those choices involve participating in risky behavior.And of course, Vegas is all about money...for the ones who are making it and the ones who are spending it.I highly doubt Sisolak is going to budge. He sounded pretty serious.

Speaking of good books to read, I may just break out Hunter S Thompson's classic..."Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas: A Savage Journey to the Heart of The American Dream"or O'Brien's "Leaving Las Vegas"Those just might be currently and sadly relevant...Edited: 4:29 pm, March 18, 2020

Its all about hitting "peak". And nobody in the USA will know that anytime soon because we don't have nearly the testing necessary to get to that point. With a complete national quarantine I guess its possible Vegas could reopen in some scaled back version of itself at some point after Memorial Day. Its hard to see the light at the end of the tunnel when we can't even see the tunnel yet.

Just watch the local and national and worldwide data of new cases vs. recovered.Social distancing plus sanitizing, if maintained, will reduce the chances of community spread. Then the # of new cases will fall as fewer sick people infect fewer others.Taiwan did it really well. Italy is a disaster. They waited too long and also didn't have the medical facilities to begin with.As this grows in foreign places worldwide travel will suffer for a long time.
"Don't forget that the medical profession will kill your life to keep you from dying from a disease." Does this make sense to anyone?

What I was trying to say is that doctors can get so focused on saving us from the virus that the rest of society dies. Talk to a terminal cancer patient toward the end of their life about how they have to balance their wanting to have some quality of life and the doctor's focus on beating the cancer for one more day.

Economically I am starting to wonder if we are doing the right thing. That is the point the mayor is trying to make without saying it. How much money is a life worth? This may sound sick but in the big picture is $3,000,000,000,000 worth 10,000 lives? I am not saying I am an expert on the total expect life loss and the total impact on the economy. I am just tossing those numbers out there. Do you know how tough a decision congress and the white house have to make? At least they are working together now. I really want to know your thoughts on this weather politically correct or not. FLWFan, not calling you out, but if you were president what would you do?Edited: 7:28 pm, March 18, 2020
This happens with every pandemic. No one takes it seriously unless it affects them. This might not even peak until June/July in a North America.

Have you seen Vegas's target market? Are you shocked that they can't stop these yokels from coming in? No.The mayor needs to put the health of her city above everything. It's sad to see her take the Goodman name and put it in the crapper with this behavior.
Well, it might come down to a Darwinian thing - “cleansing of the herd?”Hunt
Well Hunt I hope you don't think a disease killing off senior citizens is an example Darwinism. Executive summary: It's not.
The Mayor knows that will never happen. She's grandstanding for her constituents.
"Do you know how tough a decision congress and the white house have to make? "COV-19 has hit a couple of congressmen.

FLWFan #25,So, instead of concentrating on Impeachment, which was initiated, immediately after the election results, should the Democrats have, instead, been busy, taking this situation, heads-on?Just curious,Hunt
Need to keep the politics out of this. Let's just work against the virus for awhile - without bashing each other.

I was asked directly so I answered. And I'm going to answer Hunt. I have no idea what you're talking about about Hunt. There was no coronavirus activity after the impeachment hearing. The president of the United States is known as the most powerful man in the world. When that man and his media enablers continued for weeks portraying this as a hoax they did nobody any good. The most recent numbers I heard were that 85% of Democrats take this seriously while among Republican is closer to 55%. That can be attributed almost solely to lies told by the president and repeated by Fox State News. I will say no more as long as no one else asked me questions.

"Citation FLW?"You must be joking. As recently as today he called it the Chinese virus. I don't know how else to answer, everything I said is easy to find online. I usually ask for citations when I'm pretty sure the person doesn't have any. I and everybody else with the internet does with very little effort.Edited: 10:12 pm, March 18, 2020
“yet we are still here.” - Some aren’t. 13

Should I get the sheep,his tweet on Feb 24, that the coronavirus was contained ? Or his tweet shortly after that anybody who wanted a test can get a test, and they are beautiful tests? Stop defending the windbag..He was late to the party and trying to cover his tracks..Finally he has gotten on track...Too late for criticism, but not too late too point out to the sheep who think he was on top of this...Facts have a way of ruining a good narrative

Well, maybe President Trump should have called it the “One person, who ate a live bat at the Wuhan Night Market virus?”[Speculation Alert]When, and if (very big IF), the truth is published, this will come down to an attempt to weaponize, and distribute a bio weapon, which got out of control, before it could be distributed.Hope I am wrong, and just par and.It ain’t the “Eat a Live Bat Flu.”Hunt
Dawg #32,And some, who tried to warn the world, mysteriously disappeared, permanently, and quickly.Hunt

Since I have family in the medical,field who are on front lines right now, I can say without question, Blotus blew it...tests were not available,he downplayed it for weeks..Time is and was of the essence..He can say whatever he like to his base, but his words are on record, only because of his twitter addiction..
And the mayor of LV is pathetic...
Hunt,Indeed, my good man. They are mysteries for sure. 13
Que dog thanks for the quick backup, like I said I didn't know if you was joking about citations because it's all out there.As for Hunt, I hate to be cliched but tinfoil hat on tight?
It’s there for any person who doesn’t drink the koolaid
FLWFan, thank you for answering. I did ask you directly. Anyone have an opinion that letting the virus run its course would have been a better economic decision? Just throwing it out there.

Here is his tweet, hope nobody thought stock market looked good like he said , 35% ago...The Coronavirus is very much under control in the USA. We are in contact with everyone and all relevant countries. CDC & World Health have been working hard and very smart. Stock Market starting to look very good to me!Feb 24

I am not on Tweeter, but wife is on 4 conference calls per day, from the CDC, starting at 5:00am here.Then she has one with WHO, and 2 with AZ Health, then 2 more, with her healthcare corporation.Have there been issues, and problems?YesIs much being done now?YesWill this get better?Only time will tell.Hunt
I actually was joking FLW. I figured you would get it as I’m not a critic of yours. Everything doesn’t need to be serious such as the Lv forum.

Issues and problems? Without a doubt, particularly since he downplayed it for weeks..Has he finally gotten on board, and trying to do what is necessary ? Yes, reluctantly Will it get better? At some point, but not anytime soon

We have 119 confirmed cases in our province (US would call a state) and all restaurants are closed I can’t go to a gym everything is closed. This is the right measure but the supply chain scares us. Just personal opinion.

for watching the forum, and trying to book a room , May is when if not sooner Vegas will open up. I will continually book flight and room. If they cancel I will just re-book and continue to re-book. Rates are so cheap why not confirm

Days before Trump took office, there were transition meetings with Trump's team and people from the outgoingadministration. Rather than heed the warnings from Obama's team, the president ignored the risk of a pandemic. At the meetings, Trump's team was dismissive and arrogant and questioned the usefulness of transition meetings. They knew better.Edited: 11:31 pm, March 18, 2020
i encourage many to watch the Netflix episode of dirty money on trump.

If you ask me, I’d say 3 weeks shut down is about right. 4 weeks is excessive. 3 weeks technically is not a month, such as unemployment, etc. missing a month pay or mortgage or rent is serious, but 3 weeks sounds and feels much better. Oh, okay, only 3 weeks. 3 weeks sounds a lot shorter than one month.In sales, marketing or advertising, we chose these words very carefully with clear intention to mislead or misguide how you think. 7 days are better than one week, 4 weeks are better than month.Edited: 12:01 am, March 19, 2020
the last two post must be democrats. I was a democrat for over 30yrs and now I changed parties. because of idiots like you
....and 12 months is better than one year and 10 years is better than one decade.
Sir Lancelot, no reason to use namecalling.

People need to stop focusing on the deaths like that's the only thing to be concerned about. 20% of people with this need to be hospitalized. That's why Italy is screwed right now, because they cannot handle the medical caseload coming out of this. We literally don't have enough hospital beds to cover the level of hospitalizations that would come out of this. THAT is what flattening the curve is about.Also, "mild" includes "anything up to and including mild pneumonia" so it's not like 80% of people who catch this have a little sniffle or are walking around fine. People still get very sick from it even without needing to be hospitalized.Lastly, because this is a lower respiratory virus, they're still doing research on the fact that it might permanently scar lung tissue or the like. We don't know enough about this to know that even when you get better you're back to 100%.Edited: 4:18 pm, March 19, 2020
Pence as President? He may have more character than Trump. But it wouldn’t work. What the country needs is a moderate who can work with both sides.

first time back here in days. SNAFU
"People still DONT get it ! !"Coronavirus?
Are those who don't get it at more risk of getting it?

Jam #94,I think that some folk are in denial, or just totally unaware.Wed, or Thurs, a national news correspondent interviewed a couple on a deserted Las Vegas Blvd. The couple were moaning that their vacation was ruined. Apparently, they had not figured out that much of the USA was shut down! Did not catch where they were from, but they sounded like residents of the USA?People still posting to the Hawaii Forums, that they still plan on traveling there.Oh well,Hunt

Bill, that's the way I can see it going here. Most people will probably abide by the social distancing and self-isolation requirements for the first few days, maybe a week or so. But after that I think we'll see more and more people breaking ranks.This isn't going to be over in 3 months.

This could be a nurse in Las Vegas. It could be the nurse trying to take care of you if you catch covid-19."ICU RN here... we are now running out of PPE. We are being asked to wear a paper surgical mask until it is “soiled”, that’s all we get, one mask.We do have CAPRs for confirmed Covid cases, but we are running out of the face shields, so instead of grabbing a new faceshield for each patient, we are asked to wipe it down as well as we can and continue to use it way beyond what is recommended. These were meant to be single use items. This will NOT protect us..."Edited: 11:11 am, March 20, 2020
PPE is personal protection equipment.

Joanner, same here in the UK. My wife is a front line worker in the NHS in a supposed flagship hospital in London. She handles samples coming in for Covid-19 testing all the time, yet still without proper PPE!We're told it's on the way but no sign of it yet.Edited: 11:21 am, March 20, 2020
"ICU RN here... we are now running out of PPE"Well according to the "president" the states are on their own to scrounge this stuff up.https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/19/tru…

So, I'll respond to these one more time, at risk of being charged with hypocrisy regarding political comments in here.He did spit-shine some things that weren't happening; he constantly overuses the terms 'beautiful' and 'incredible', when at times the beautiful and incredible things aren't even functioning yet; he misrepresented some things when he shouldn't have, despite the likelihood he was making an attempt to calm the public regarding the situation..doesn't excuse it. Unfortunately, he's just not a gaggable human being; as a general supporter, my worst complaints about him are his use of words and dressing things up.Regarding the disbanding of the pandemic force, it happened. He has routinely asked for CDC budget cuts since he's been in office; the irony is the overall budget distributions for the CDC have actually INCREASED under his 3+ year stint ( because Congress has to pass spending bills..they rejected his CDC budget proposals in this specific area and funded increases).As for attacking the press ( whom in fact don't always or seldom focus on truths from either side of the spectrum), anybody who has endured the onslaught he has since his inauguration is naturally going to resist some journalistic sensationalism if he perceives it as such. I think he perceives most of it that way. Let's face it ( or I'll suggest it), there just isn't much journalistic integrity left from our media these days. There are a few, agreed ( and even fewer who are unbiased).Most reasonable folk ( in spite of the recent positive polling in favor of Trump's COVID handling cited in an earlier thread post) would at least agree he's now engaged on this situation. That scares some of you..it shouldn't. Even Schumer isn't bad-mouthing him of late. It's a shame that the current debacle had to occur for the politicians to work together on something for the good of the folks that put them in office and pay their salaries, isn't it? We won't go into other, unrelated Trump mistakes..there's plenty. Pick any guy/ person and cast the first stone. I'll just say this, to be clear ( which is a very disgusting oft used political phrase)..I voted for him in 2016 and unless they produce photos of him and a goat in a barn somewhere( or something really off-the-wall beyond routine verbal gaffs), I'll do it again this fall. It's about the conservative policy/ issue stances..he's accomplished some things I agree with. If you disagree with those, fine..vote him out. If you disagree on moral grounds, fine..vote him out. If you don't like his hair and think that's critical, fine..vote him out. That's your strongest weapon to make him irrelevant.
